intro: Styphelia scabrella, commonly known as the scaly heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes shrubs and flowering plants adapted to acidic soils. The plant features small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow, leathery, and covered in a distinctive scaly texture. Styphelia scabrella thrives in moist, shaded environments such as pine forests and rocky slopes.
